The place itself is fabulous. Bathroom is amazing with seat and rainfall shower. The bed is adjustable which was a very pleasant surprise. The views out are fabulous though i didn't get to sit outside and enjoy due to all the rain.
You cannot go wrong staying here if you're stopping over or staying a few days. There is a small fridge, some snacks and water so keep that in mind. If you desire big meals you will have to go out or bring something to cook in the provided microwave. All in all an A+++ experience.

The back door is unlocked 24/7 because the latch is misadjusted and does not secure at all. In addition to the public traffic from the marina, the foot ramp to access this boat is less than 20 feet from the entrance to a large city park. Any one of the nine homeless people I passed on my morning walk the day we left could have easily gone in for a look around or to do whatever unfortunate thing that went on to cause the damage after we left.
Besides the security issues, I lacerated my hand on one of the sharp edges of internal trim in the boat. This impacted my ability to work for the following week. I did notify the owner that I cut my hand and accidentally got some of the blood on the bedsheets. I put them in the wash when we left and offered to reimburse if it didn't come out. Instead the owner billed us $1600 for other damage that we didn't cause and was not there when we left.
Avoid this disaster and these scam artist hosts at all costs.
